task.title: Overriding global validation preferences
task.shortdesc: For a given project, you can override the global validation preferences.

context.p: The default validation preferences are specified globally on the Validation page of the Preferences dialog. To allow projects to override these default validation preferences:

step.cmd: In the Preferences window, click Validation in the left pane.
step.stepresult: The Validation page of the Preferences window lists the validators available in your project and their settings.

step.cmd: Select the Allow projects to override these preference settings check box.

step.stepresult: Now individual projects can override the global preferences.

step.cmd: Right-click a project and then click Properties.
In the left pane of the Properties window, click Validation.
Select the Override validation preferences check box.
step.info: This check box is available only if you checked the Allow projects to override these preference settings check box on the workbench validation preferences page.

step.cmd: To prevent validation for this project, select the Suspend all validators check box.
In the list of validators, select the check boxes next to each validator you want to use.
step.info: Each validator has a check box to specify whether it is used on manual validation or on a build.

step.cmd: Choose an alternate implementation for a validator by clicking the button in the Settings column.
step.info: Not all validators have alternate implementations.
